definition: to give up defending/to yield/to surrender
to abandon/to relinquish/to discard/to throw away
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining

sentences.english: The enemy was advancing. The snow was stained with blood.
sentences.chinese: 首都被迫弃守，敌人步步进逼，鲜血将白雪浸染。

sentences.english: The town was forced to yield after a long siege.
sentences.chinese: 该城受长期围困而被迫弃守。

sentences.english: Wu the day see half the battle, decided to abandon keep PangCheng retreat.
sentences.chinese: 吴霸天见大势已去，决定弃守撤退庞城。

sentences.english: They surrendered the fortress to the enemy.

definition: to retreat and defend/to withdraw and maintain one's guard
to defend one's property to the death/to cling obstinately to old habits/die-hard
to advance on sth/to press closely (on some goal)
(military) (of a city etc) to fall into enemy hands/(fig.) to take a turn for the worse
to guard/to hold a fortified position/entrenched
to seize control of (an enemy position)/(fig.) to take by storm/to gain (awards, control of a market etc)
to surrender (of a fortress)/to fall (to the enemy)/subsidence (of land)
to flee in disorder/defeated and in rout
to stand a siege/trapped in a besieged city
to reinforce/to increase troop numbers/reinforcements/extra troops
to strongly defend one's position/to be entrenched/to cling to
